title: Add above-the-fold FOMO trust indicator and live social-proof popups to landing page

requirements.text: Add a strong FOMO trust indicator immediately below the main registration CTA button in the hero section registration form, centered and visible above the fold, with the exact text: ‚Äúüî• 3,000+ students have already registered‚Äù. The line must be slightly smaller than the CTA button text and highlighted using a soft contrasting background (light yellow or light green) with a subtle icon (üî• or üë•) before the text.

quotes: Update the existing landing page design and content with a strong FOMO trust indicator placed immediately below the main registration button in the hero section.

Add a small but highly visible highlighted line that reads:

‚Äúüî• 3,000+ students have already registered‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page hero section, directly under the RegistrationForm submit button (‚ÄúRegister Now for Free‚Äù), a centered highlighted line is rendered with the exact text: ‚Äúüî• 3,000+ students have already registered‚Äù.
The trust indicator is visible without scrolling on common mobile and desktop viewports (above the fold).
The trust indicator uses a soft contrasting background (light yellow or light green) and a subtle leading icon (üî• or üë•).
The trust indicator font size is visibly smaller than the CTA button text.
No backend changes are required for this trust indicator.

requirements.text: Implement a lightweight live social-proof notification popup system on the landing page that periodically shows a single bottom-left notification card with the format ‚Äú{Name} from {City} registered {TimeAgo}‚Äù, using the provided predefined Indian names list and provided Indian cities list, and randomly rotating through recent ‚ÄúTimeAgo‚Äù strings.

quotes: Create an advanced live social proof notification popup system on my landing page.

Each popup should display:

‚Äú{Name} from {City} registered {TimeAgo}‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: A notification card appears in the bottom-left corner of the landing page and displays exactly: ‚Äú{Name} from {City} registered {TimeAgo}‚Äù.
Only one popup is visible at a time.
Popups appear on a random interval between 6 and 10 seconds (inclusive) and auto-hide after ~4 seconds.
The popup uses a smooth fade-in + slide-up animation on show and a smooth fade-out (no abrupt removal).
The notification card design is clean and modern with: white background, soft shadow, rounded corners, and a small green dot/tick icon on the left.
The popup is responsive and does not block critical UI on mobile (including the registration CTA).
Implementation is lightweight and does not add heavy external libraries.

requirements.text: Enforce non-repeating name logic per visitor for the social-proof popups: shuffle the name list on page load, pick names without replacement, persist which names were shown using sessionStorage or localStorage, and stop showing popups once all names are used; cities may repeat. Keep all variables (names list, cities list, timing ranges, time-ago options) easy to customize later in code.

quotes:
Once a name is shown:

Never repeat the same name for the same visitor

Use sessionStorage or localStorage to track shown names

Shuffle name list on page load

Pick names without replacement

Track shown names per visitor

Stop popups once all names are used

Do NOT loop names again

Implement using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and keep all variables (names, cities, timing) easy to customize later.

acceptanceCriteria: For a given browser visitor, the system never shows the same name twice across popups until the provided names list is exhausted.

The system stores shown-name state in sessionStorage or localStorage so that refreshing the page does not cause already-shown names to reappear during the same visitor‚Äôs stored session/history (depending on the chosen storage).
The names list is shuffled on initial load before selection begins (not displayed alphabetically).
The system stops scheduling new popups after all unique names from the provided list have been used; it does not loop/restart names.
Cities are chosen randomly from the provided cities list and may repeat even when names cannot repeat.
All lists and timing parameters are defined in a clearly editable place (e.g., constants/config) rather than being scattered through component logic.

constraints: Frontend must not add heavy external libraries for the popup system.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for these UI-only enhancements.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not implement real-time or backend-driven social proof based on actual registrations.
Do not add third-party analytics, tracking pixels, or external notification services.
Do not change the existing registration submission flow or WhatsApp redirect behavior beyond placing the trust indicator under the CTA button.
